member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis
member.summary: Main class of the PDF Metamorphosis .Net. Allows to export Text, RTF, DOCX and HTML to PDF; split and merge PDF documents.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.HtmlSetting
member.summary: Set options necessary for HTML to PDF conversion, such as BaseUrl etc.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.HtmlSetting.BaseUrl
member.summary: The part of document’s URL preceding its name. Default value: .
member.remarks:
A URL assigned to a page to convert "relative URLs" into "absolute URLs" by the addition of a document name or trailing slash /.
It’s very important to set this property when converting HTML document in memory in order to determine where all relative URLs are pointing to and convert them to absolute.
For example, let's convert HTML string to a PDF file.
Assuming we've specified:
p.HtmlOptions.BaseUrl = @"d:\my webs";
Now when the component meets 'src="images/asterisk.jpg"' it will try to load an image from: "d:\my webs\images\asterisk.jpg"

code.source: ..\Packages\PDF Metamorphosis .Net\Code samples\CSharp\ASP.Net - Convert HTML to PDF\Default.aspx.cs
code.title: Using the property BaseUrl in ASP.Net application

code.source: ..\Packages\PDF Metamorphosis .Net\Code samples\VB.Net\ASP.Net - Convert HTML to PDF\Default.aspx.vb
code.title: Using the property BaseUrl in ASP.Net application

GIF
JPEG
PNG
TIFF

member.remarks: 0 - means absolutely invisible, 100% transparent.

Text, HTML to PDF: Letter.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PageSetting.PageNumbers
member.summary: Allows to set page numbers and their properties in PDF.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PageSetting.PageNumbers.Text
member.summary: Set a custom page numbers in produced PDF document. Default value: "".
member.remarks:
Default value: empty string
Using this property you may set custom page numbers as you wish.
These are special keywords to custom page numbers:
{page} - current page number
{numpages} - total pages

member.summary: Set header/footer from any DOCX, RTF, HTML or Text file.
member.remarks: We don't recommend to use it for complex HTML documents as header or footer. The best is using simple HTML table with text and images as header/footer.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.EmbedAllFonts
member.summary: Embed all used fonts inside the PDF document. Default value: false.
member.remarks: This makes the PDF document completely standalone and independent of fonts installed on the computer where the PDF document will be opened.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.ClipboardTextProtection
member.summary: Gets and sets the protection on copying of all text from PDF document through clipboard. Default value: false.
member.remarks: In case of true, it's impossible to copy text to the clipboard from resulting PDF. Important: The PDF document can be displayed incorrectly in some editors and converted back to Word also incorrectly.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.Compression
member.summary: Allows to set compression type to change size of the PDF document. Default value: true.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.ImageQuality
member.summary: Specify the image quality from 10 ... 1000. Allows to reduce the size of PDF document due to loss of quality of embedded images. Default value: 100.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.FontsDirectory
member.summary: Full local path to fonts directory (any folder with *.ttf files). Default value: Fonts directory of the current OS.
member.remarks:
Advice for developers who creates ASP.Net or Silverlight projects:
Some hosting providers disables any access to windows directories. For example, GoDaddy doesn't allow to read directory "Windows\Fonts".
We recommend to create own "Fonts" directory in your project and copy *.ttf files to it from "Windows\Fonts". You may copy only several fonts, but we recommend to put the font "Arial Unicode MS" - ARIALUNI.TTF anyway.
See picture:

member.summary: Converts a Text file to PDF file.

0 - converting successfully
3 - converting failed. (For details see: .)

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.TextToPdfConvertStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Convert the stream with Text document to a PDF stream.
member.remarks: The docx to pdf conversion method is available starting from .Net 3.5 or above. We recommend you to use the PdfMetamorphosis.dll compiled for the latest .Net.
member.returns: PDF document as byte array, or null in case of converting failed.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.TextToPdfConvertByte(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts array of Text bytes into array of PDF bytes.
member.returns: PDF document as byte array, or null in case of converting failed

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.TextToPdfConvertStringToByte(System.String)
member.summary: Converts string of Text into array of PDF bytes.
member.returns: PDF document as byte array, or null in case of converting failed

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.DocxToPdfConvertFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts DOCX file to PDF file.
member.param: Path to a local DOCX file.
A local path to create a PDF file.
member.remarks: The docx to pdf conversion method is available starting from .Net 3.5 or above. We recommend you to use the PdfMetamorphosis.dll compiled for the latest .Net.
member.returns:
0 - converting successfully
1 - can't open input DOCX file, check the input path.
2 - can't create output PDF file, check the output path.
3 - conversion failed.

member.returns: PDF document as byte array, or null in case of converting failed.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.DocxToPdfConvertByte(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Convert the array of bytes with DOCX document to a PDF bytes array.
member.remarks: The docx to pdf conversion method is available starting from .Net 3.5 or above. We recommend you to use the PdfMetamorphosis.dll compiled for the latest .Net.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.MergePDFFileArrayToPDFFile(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Merge several PDF files into a single PDF file
member.param: Array of paths to PDF documents
Path to resulting PDF, it will be created by the component or overwritten if the PDF document already exists
member.returns:
0 - merged successfully
1 - error, can't merge PDF documents
2 - error, can't create output file, probably it used by another application
3 - merging failed
4 - merged successfully, but some files were not merged

code.source: ..\Packages\PDF Metamorphosis .Net\Code samples\CSharp\Console - Split and Merge PDF\sample.cs
code.title: How to split and merge PDF documents using C#

code.title: How to split and merge PDF documents using VB.Net

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.MergePDFFileToPDFFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Merge two PDF files. Merge File1Path and DestFile file into a single DestFile.
member.param: Path to an existing PDF file
Path to a second PDF file to merge the first file into
member.remarks: If the second file does not already exist the component just copies the first file to a new name
member.returns:
0 - merged successfully
1 - error, can't merge PDF documents
2 - error, can't create output file, probably it used by another application
3 - merging failed

member.summary: Merge several PDF files into a single document as byte stream
member.param: Array of paths to PDF documents
member.returns: Single PDF document as byte array or null in case of merging failed

member.summary: Merge several PDF documents into a single document in memory

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PrintPdf(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Print the PDF file using the default printer with time settings
member.param: Path to the PDF file to be printed
Timeout in seconds to load Adobe Reader
Timeout in seconds to send PDF document on print
member.remarks: This method uses the "Adobe Reader" to print PDF documents. Please be sure that you have installed "Acrobat Reader".
